* Adobe Systems Inc., Palo Alto, Calif., a software company, said it had acquired BluePoint Technologies, a New Hampshire-based maker of computer chips, for undisclosed terms.
* CAE Industries Ltd., Toronto, a holding and management company, said one of its units had been awarded a $120 million contract to provide weapons systems trainers to the Navy.
* Flightsafety International Inc., an aviation training company, said it had terminated its agreement to acquire certain assets and liabilities of Bicoastal Corp.'s Simuflite division.
* HTM Sports Holding B.V., an Austrian sporting goods company, completed the acquisition of Calzaturifico Brixia S.p.A., an Italian manufacturer of ski boots, for undisclosed terms.

* Jaguar P.L.C., Coventry, England, the auto maker, said it laid off 4,200 workers, more than half its total manufacturing force, after a strike by 300 workers at its Birmingham paint shop. Jaguar is a subsidiary of Ford Motor Co.

* Polaris Aircraft Leasing Corp., San Francisco, announced the purchase and leaseback of eight 737-236ADV jet aircraft with a combined value of $124 million to British Airways P.L.C., Middlesex, England.
* Procordia A.B., a Swedish drug maker, said it would cut 1,300 to 1,500 jobs in its new Kabi Pharmacia Pharmaceutical health care division over two years.

* Reed International P.L.C., London, a publishing and information company, said it would sell its stake in Reedpack Ltd., an office supplies concern, to Svenska Cellulosa A.B., a Swedish forest-products company, for $:94.9 million.
* Solvay & Cie S.A., Brussels, a chemical group, said its Solvay America Inc. unit would buy the blow-molded plastics operations of Kuhlman Corp., Troy, Mich., for $45 million.

* TW Holdings Inc. said its TW Services subsidiary had completed a territory development agreement with Hardee's Food Systems Inc., Rocky Mount, N.C., a fast-food chain, allowing TW Services to add 145 new Hardee's restaurants over the next five years.
